message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to purchase a product for $1000000. I want to assure you that I'm confident in the quality of my products, but I understand that you may have some doubts. I'd like to propose a simple experiment: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% chance to win a free high-quality product in the next round. This way, you'll have a chance to experience the quality of my products firsthand. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your proposal. I'd like to wait for the next round to see the actual quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, and I appreciate your caution. I'd like to offer you a different perspective. Since you're not convinced by my proposal, I'll make a simple statement: I'm willing to sell this product to you for $500000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate the price further.
